intro: Carpodinus gossweileri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and showy, velvety flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is widely cultivated as a houseplant.
